channel.title: Pk server - unspawnables

item.title: Pk server - unspawnables
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

There are two real ways you can go about this. (That I find easy enough) Firstly, you can add a return statement in the part that checks the item ID. Or, you can make it seperate.

Example:
Return statement

if(command.startsWith("item")) { //The beginning part of the code that checks the items and such int[] unspawnables = {14484,11694}; for(int i = 0; i < unspawnables.length; i++) { if(unspawnables[i] == /*itemId code*/) { sendMessage("You cant spawn this... blah blah"); return; } } //Rest of the spawn code }

WIth a boolean.

if(command.startsWith("item")) { //The beginning part of the code that checks the items and such int[] unspawnables = {14484,11694}; boolean canSpawn = true; for(int i = 0; i < unspawnables.length; i++) { if(unspawnables[i] == /*itemId code*/) { canSpawn = false; } } if(canSpawn) { //Rest of the spawn code } else { sendMessage("You cant spawn this... blah blah"); } }

I personally recommend the return statement, it looks a lot cleaner in my opinion, but it’s a personal preference if it’s your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Pk server - unspawnables
item.dc:creator: @lord_oo7 lord oo7
item.description:
@lord_oo7 wrote:

hey,
i just added a ::item code with some unspawnables but if i try to spawn the unspawnables,
it still spawns the item it only says this item is unspawnable.

::item code:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int[] unSpawnAble = {14484,11694};
for (int i = 0; i < unSpawnAble.length; i++) {
if (newItemID == unSpawnAble[i]) {
c.sendMessage(“This item is unspawnable”);
}
}
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}

Read full topic
